metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological observation data of E’bao station upstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015.The station is located in qinghai qilian county E’bao town grassland, the underlying surface is alpine grassland.The latitude and longitude of the observation point are 100.9151E, 37.9492N, and 3294m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set up at 5m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in an anti-skid box on the ground;The inverted bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;Wind speed and direction sensors are set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil moisture probe is buried 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, directly to the south of 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground 6cm, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: volume water content, percentage).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;The four-component radiation and infrared temperature were between October 11, 2015 and November 05, 2015.11.1-11.5 re-adjustment of observation tower instruments, data missing;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2015-9-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Liu et al. (2018) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al. (2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游峨堡站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县峨堡镇草场，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.9151E, 37.9492N，海拔3294m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；四分量辐射与红外温度在2015.10.11-11.05之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；11.1-11.5之间重新调试观测塔仪器，数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体体现在E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率上。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，与EC系统的测量值相比，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是源头水，需要进行调节以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪盖的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析较为复杂，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有益的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形等几大严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还从一个冻土观测超级站获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据以研究气象驱动因素，并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在集中的观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。每个AMS内的六个层次测量土壤温度和湿度，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）进行测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）由GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，采用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还从冻土观测超级站获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程。这些更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（飘雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a 'hydrometeorological observation network' and how is it implemented in alpine research?
Definition.QuestionCn: “水文气象观测网络”是指用于收集和监测水文和气象数据的系统。这种网络通常包括气象站、水文测量站和其他相关设备，以便获取有关降水、温度、湿度、风速、流量和水位等信息。在阿尔卑斯地区的研究中，水文气象观测网络的实施通常涉及在不同的地理位置设置观测站，以便全面了解该地区的气候变化、雪融化、冰川动态和水资源管理等问题。这些数据对于研究气候变化的影响、生态系统的健康以及自然灾害的预测和管理至关重要。
Definition.AnswerEn: A hydrometeorological observation network is an integrated system of automatic meteorological stations and superstations designed to monitor meteorological and hydrological variables. In alpine research, it is implemented to capture data on meteorological driving forces, snow cover, and frozen ground processes by employing instruments like flow capt for measuring blowing snow, and GMON for snow water equivalent, among others. These networks aim to provide spatially distributed data for model validation and understanding hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 水文气象观测网络是一个集成的自动气象站和超级站系统，旨在监测气象和水文变量。在阿尔卑斯研究中，它被实施用于捕捉气象驱动因素、雪盖和冻土过程的数据，采用如流量捕捉器（flow capt）测量吹雪，以及GMON测量雪水当量等仪器。这些网络旨在提供空间分布的数据，以便进行模型验证和理解阿尔卑斯地区的水文过程。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the 'freeze-thaw processes' and why are they significant in alpine hydrology research?
Definition.QuestionCn: “冻融过程”是指水分在低温条件下冻结，然后在温度升高时融化的循环过程。这些过程在高山水文学研究中具有重要意义，因为它们影响水文循环、土壤稳定性和生态系统的水资源可用性。
Definition.AnswerEn: Freeze-thaw processes refer to the cyclical freezing and thawing of the active layer in soil, affecting soil moisture and temperature. They are significant in alpine hydrology research because they influence water infiltration, surface runoff, and groundwater dynamics. Understanding these processes is crucial for evaluating the impact of climate change on hydrological cycles in alpine regions, and for improving hydrological models' accuracy.
Definition.AnswerCn: 冻融过程是指土壤中活跃层的周期性冻结和解冻，影响土壤湿度和温度。这些过程在高山水文学研究中具有重要意义，因为它们影响水的渗透、地表径流和地下水动态。理解这些过程对于评估气候变化对高山地区水文循环的影响以及提高水文模型的准确性至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations in alpine hydrology compare to its use in heterogeneous agricultural landscapes in terms of improving predictive models?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学中，遥感数据与地面观测的集成与其在异质农业景观中的应用相比，在改善预测模型方面有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In alpine hydrology, integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations helps in capturing snow cover and frozen ground processes, which are critical for hydrological modeling. This integration addresses data scarcity and enhances model accuracy. In heterogeneous agricultural landscapes, remote sensing combined with ground-based data focuses on accurately estimating soil and vegetation temperatures, improving evapotranspiration models. Both approaches aim to reduce uncertainties and improve predictive capabilities but focus on different environmental variables and challenges.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学中，整合遥感数据与地面观测有助于捕捉雪盖和冻土过程，这对水文模型至关重要。这种整合解决了数据稀缺的问题，并提高了模型的准确性。在异质农业景观中，遥感结合地面数据专注于准确估计土壤和植被温度，从而改善蒸散发模型。这两种方法旨在减少不确定性并提高预测能力，但关注的环境变量和挑战不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of ground-based measurements and remote sensing data improve the accuracy of hydrological models in alpine regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 地面测量和遥感数据的结合如何提高高山地区水文模型的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Combining ground-based measurements with remote sensing data can improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data, validating remote sensing data, and allowing the evaluation of distributed models. This approach is essential due to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions caused by difficult access and technological barriers.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合可以通过提供准确的强迫数据、验证遥感数据以及评估分布式模型来改善水文过程的预测。这种方法在高山地区尤为重要，因为由于难以到达和技术障碍，观测数据稀缺。

Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in the alpine region is due to difficulties of access and technological barriers. This scarcity has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research, motivating the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes errors in estimating component temperatures in evapotranspiration models, particularly in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在蒸散发模型中，特别是在干旱地区，导致组件温度估计错误的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in derived component temperatures are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These errors can lead to an overestimation of canopy temperature, particularly in regions with developing vegetation abundance. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can contribute to uncertainties in estimated temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 衍生组件温度的误差主要是由图像分类错误引起的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些错误可能导致在植被丰度较高的地区对树冠温度的高估。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率也会导致估计温度的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation for hydrological process predictions in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用遥感数据结合数据同化进行高山地区水文过程预测的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing more accurate and integrated datasets. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions, which need to be validated and calibrated. This approach can fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research by providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validating remote sensing data, and allowing the evaluation of distributed models.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用遥感数据结合数据同化可以通过提供更准确和综合的数据集来改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据中存在各种不确定性来源，尤其是在高山地区，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。这种方法可以填补知识空白，促进高山地区水文学研究，通过提供准确的水文模型强迫数据、验证遥感数据以及允许对分布式模型进行评估。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind establishing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network for collecting hydrometeorological data in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立一个集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络以收集高山地区的水文气象数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological models, validate remote sensing data, and improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions by collecting comprehensive datasets of hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并通过收集全面的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to incorporate both ground-based and remote sensing data for hydrological modeling in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区的水文建模中，结合地面观测数据和遥感数据是非常重要的，原因如下：
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Incorporating both types of data is crucial for improving the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate and effective forcing data, validating remote sensing data, and addressing the scarcity of observation data due to access difficulties and technological barriers in alpine regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 结合这两种数据对于提高水文过程的预测至关重要，因为它提供了准确有效的强迫数据，验证了遥感数据，并解决了由于进入困难和技术障碍在高山地区观察数据稀缺的问题。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives drive the application of advanced techniques and instruments in observing snow accumulation and ablation processes within alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 推动在高山水文学研究中应用先进技术和仪器观察雪积累和融化过程的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to capture detailed snow cover properties to better understand snow accumulation and ablation processes, which are key to investigating watershed science and functions, and to provide datasets that support the development and validation of remote sensing products and hydrological models.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是捕捉详细的雪盖特性，以更好地理解雪的积累和融化过程，这对研究流域科学和功能至关重要，并提供支持遥感产品和水文模型开发与验证的数据集。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What techniques are employed to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data collected from hydrometeorological stations in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保从高山地区水文气象站收集的数据准确性和一致性所采用的技术有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure accuracy and consistency, data collected from hydrometeorological stations involve several techniques such as installing automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) to capture spatially distributed meteorological variables and using state-of-the-art instruments at snow observation superstations for capturing snow accumulation and ablation processes. High-resolution soil physics datasets are also obtained to monitor freeze-thaw processes, and gap-free data are ensured by connecting these stations into an integrated observation network.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保准确性和一致性，从水文气象站收集的数据采用了多种技术，例如安装自动气象站（AMS）以捕捉空间分布的气象变量，并在雪观测超级站使用先进仪器来捕捉雪的积累和融化过程。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以监测冻融过程，并通过将这些站点连接成一个综合观测网络来确保无间隙数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the accurate collection and validation of snow cover and frozen ground data in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够准确收集和验证高山地区的雪盖和冻土数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The methodologies involve using an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network that includes automatic meteorological stations, snow observation superstations, and frozen ground observation superstations. Techniques such as using SR50A for snow depth measurements, GMON for snow water equivalent, and FlowCapt for measuring blowing snow are employed to ensure accuracy and validation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 这些方法涉及使用一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，包括自动气象站、雪观测超级站和冻土观测超级站。采用SR50A进行雪深测量，GMON用于雪水当量测量，以及FlowCapt用于测量吹雪，以确保准确性和验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do technological advancements facilitate the overcoming of data scarcity challenges in alpine hydrological research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 技术进步如何促进克服阿尔卑斯水文研究中的数据稀缺挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements like remote sensing combined with data assimilation, the establishment of next-generation ecosystem observation networks, and the use of high-resolution thermal infrared cameras and eddy covariance systems enable more comprehensive data collection and modeling, thus addressing data scarcity challenges in alpine hydrological research.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如遥感结合数据同化、下一代生态系统观测网络的建立，以及高分辨率热红外相机和涡度协方差系统的使用，使得数据收集和建模更加全面，从而解决了高山水文研究中的数据稀缺挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection in alpine regions face significant challenges, and how could these affect the development of hydrological models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，数据收集可能面临重大挑战，这些挑战可能会影响水文模型的发展。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行完整和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are some expected outcomes of using integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks in alpine hydrology research, and why might these outcomes not always be achieved?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中，使用集成、分布式和多尺度观测网络的预期结果包括：提高对水文过程的理解、增强水资源管理的能力、改善气候变化影响的预测、促进跨学科合作以及支持政策制定。然而，这些结果可能并不总是实现，原因包括数据整合的复杂性、技术和资金限制、不同学科之间的沟通障碍、以及对观测网络的维护和管理不足等。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network is expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and allow evaluation of distributed models. However, outcomes may not be achieved due to the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, technological barriers, or strong winds affecting data accuracy.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并允许评估分布式模型。然而，由于高山地区观测数据稀缺、技术障碍或强风影响数据准确性，可能无法实现预期结果。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the estimation of soil heat conductivity be particularly challenging in alpine regions, and what methods could potentially address these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，土壤热导率的估算可能特别具有挑战性，原因包括土壤类型多样、气候变化剧烈、土壤水分含量变化大以及地形复杂等。为了应对这些挑战，可以考虑采用以下方法：使用现场测量技术、应用遥感技术、结合数值模型进行模拟、以及进行长期监测以获取更准确的数据。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content, and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models to address these challenges.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化，以应对这些挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in ensuring the accuracy and quality control of data collected from hydrometeorological observation networks in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 确保从高山地区的水文气象观测网络收集的数据的准确性和质量控制的潜在挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in ensuring accuracy and quality control of data collected from hydrometeorological observation networks in alpine regions include the harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which can hinder complete and consistent data collection. The scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers also poses a significant challenge.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 确保来自高山地区水文气象观测网络收集的数据的准确性和质量控制面临的挑战包括恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素可能会妨碍完整和一致的数据收集。由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺性也构成了一个重大挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might the integration of remote sensing data and ground-based observations enhance the effectiveness of hydrological modeling in alpine catchments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 遥感数据与地面观测的结合如何增强高山流域水文模型的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations can enhance the effectiveness of hydrological modeling by improving the prediction of hydrological processes and validating remote sensing data. This combined approach can help fill knowledge gaps and provide accurate forcing data for models, allowing for a better understanding of alpine hydrological processes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与地面观测的结合可以通过改善水文过程的预测和验证遥感数据来增强水文模型的有效性。这种综合方法可以帮助填补知识空白，并为模型提供准确的强迫数据，从而更好地理解高山水文过程。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways do advanced observation networks and technologies contribute to the refinement of datasets for studying ecohydrological processes in alpine environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 先进的观测网络和技术如何有助于精细化数据集，以研究高山环境中的生态水文过程？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Advanced observation networks and technologies contribute to the refinement of datasets by offering high-resolution data on soil physics, snow cover, and frozen ground processes. These networks, including automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, provide comprehensive data that support the development and validation of hydrological models and remote sensing products.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 先进的观测网络和技术通过提供关于土壤物理、雪盖和冻土过程的高分辨率数据，促进了数据集的精细化。这些网络，包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站，提供全面的数据，支持水文模型和遥感产品的开发与验证。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data collection methods adapt to the challenges of high-altitude and complex terrains in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据收集方法如何适应高海拔和复杂地形的阿尔卑斯地区的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In alpine regions, an integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological observation network is utilized. This includes automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations for snow cover and frozen ground. These methods are crucial for capturing the unique hydrological processes, such as snow accumulation and freeze-thaw cycles, despite the challenging climate and terrain.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，采用了一种集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象观测网络。这包括自动气象站（AMS）和用于雪盖和冻土的超级站。这些方法对于捕捉独特的水文过程，如雪积累和冻融循环，至关重要，尽管面临着严峻的气候和地形挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the specific data collection techniques used to measure soil and canopy temperatures for estimating evapotranspiration.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定用于测量土壤和树冠温度以估算蒸散的具体数据收集技术。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures are used, often obtained via high-resolution thermal cameras. These temperatures are used as inputs to the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model, which helps in estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration more accurately.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度通常通过高分辨率热像仪获得。这些温度作为输入用于双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，从而更准确地估计蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how datasets are managed to ensure accuracy, especially when dealing with missing data or sensor malfunctions in harsh environments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何管理数据集以确保准确性，特别是在处理缺失数据或恶劣环境中的传感器故障时。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data management in harsh environments involves several quality control measures, such as marking missing data, removing duplicate records, and deleting physically unrealistic data. Observations are often supplemented by gap-free monitoring and validation against remote sensing products to ensure dataset accuracy and reliability.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在恶劣环境中的数据管理涉及多个质量控制措施，例如标记缺失数据、删除重复记录和删除物理上不合理的数据。观察通常通过无间隙监测和与遥感产品的验证来补充，以确保数据集的准确性和可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies for improving the predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions using integrated datasets.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 探索利用综合数据集提高对高山地区水文过程预测理解的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Improving predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions can be achieved by developing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network that includes meteorological, snow, and frozen ground data. This approach provides accurate forcing data for hydrological models and validates remote sensing products. Combining observations, simulations, and acquired datasets allows for a more informative understanding of how perturbations like climate change and human activities affect fundamental processes. Networks like the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) and collaborations across global and community-based platforms can support these efforts.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 改善对高山地区水文过程的预测理解可以通过建立一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络来实现，该网络包括气象、雪和冻土数据。这种方法为水文模型提供了准确的强迫数据，并验证了遥感产品。结合观测、模拟和获取的数据集，可以更全面地理解气候变化和人类活动等扰动如何影响基本过程。国际高山研究流域水文网络（INARCH）等网络以及全球和社区基础平台之间的合作可以支持这些努力。
